description.narrative: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring rating of Good based on an AIMM score of 48. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 64. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to financial services for MSMEs in Uzbekistan, including women-owned SMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market inclusiveness in Uzbekistan via competition and demonstration channels.

The proposed Project consists of an up to US$50 million equivalent investment package to Joint Stock Commercial Bank with Foreign Capital Hamkorbank (Hamkorbank or the Bank), a private Uzbek bank, to support the Banks local currency financing of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and help it expand offering to women-owned SMEs (WSMEs), including women-owned very small enterprises (WVSEs). The package includes: (i) an IFC A loan of up to US$15 million equivalent to be disbursed as an Uzbek Soum (UZS)-linked loan; and (ii) an up to US$35 million mobilization of B Loans. An additional parallel loan mobilization is also being considered. The proceeds of the financing package will be used for on-lending to MSMEs, including WSMEs and WVSEs.
